articles.title: Show HN: Yet Another Status Page FYI â€“ Without Selling Your Kidneys
articles.description:
Hey HN!

I've been running side projects for years and every time I needed a status page I set up one of the many ones out there, before long I am paying more than what I believe it's worth for something as simple as it is.

So as a serial side hustler... I thought why not just smash one out.

StatusPage (https://statuspage.fyi) does uptime monitoring + status pages + incident management in one place.

There's a free tier. Actually free. Not "free for 14 days then we guilt you" free. Yeah ok it's not huge, but still 2 monitors, 1 status page, forever, it's a start, then a pricing that scales. I believe most people like me who run the odd little hustles wont break out past the $3 tier, and for those more serious companies that do have some cash and have a serious subscriber list can help cover the cost of us indies.

Still adding features (incident response/on-call is coming soonâ„¢), but it's been running my own stuff reliably for a while now.

Would love feedback. Roast my pricing. Tell me what's missing. Or just say hi.

Peace out fellow nerds.

articles.title: Show HN: TiniText â€“ Small tools for transcription, summaries and drafts
articles.description:
Hi HN,

This is my first time sharing something like this here. I built TiniText to solve a problem I kept running into myself: I needed simple tools for transcription, summaries, and drafts, but most options felt heavier than necessary for everyday use.

Instead of building a large platform, I focused on small, single-purpose tools with predictable behavior and minimal setup.

The app supports: - Audio transcription (single and multi-speaker) - Text summarization with adjustable detail - Simple draft generation (blogs / meeting notes) - A few practical text utilities

Itâ€™s production-ready but still early, and Iâ€™d really appreciate feedback on: - where the UX feels unnecessary - whatâ€™s missing for real-world use - whether â€œsmall focused toolsâ€ is still a compelling direction

Happy to answer questions.
